function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Increased re-suspension of virus-laden particles due to desk or ceiling fans","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Risk of increased rates of deposition of virus-laden particles due to fan usage","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain deposition rates of covid-19-laden particles in real-world conditions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential risk of increasing the re-suspension of virus-laden particles within the space due to the use of desk fans","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Ceiling fans inhibiting the vertical mixing and dilution of virus-laden particles within the breathing zone","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain effectiveness of air ionization technology in eliminating sars-cov-2 and potential production of by-products such as ozone","category":"Interactions","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"The use of screens may mitigate the risk of transmission for larger droplets, but may not effectively reduce the risk of airborne transmission smaller droplets or droplet nuclei .","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Installation of screens may lead to stagnant or recirculating airflow patterns, creating areas where viruses could accumulate.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Upper room ultra-violet germicidal irradiation uvgi may pose a risk if not implemented or maintained properly, leading to potential exposure to harmful uv radiation.","category":"Structure","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Limited real-world studies on the application of upper room ultra-violet uv
